Boston Christian Scientist (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: Boston Christian Scientist Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Boston Christian Scientist. A Magazine Devoted to the Cause of Christian Science. 1889—1890 Monthly Boston, MA. Publisher: Boston Christian Science Society. Editor: Charles A.S. Troup. Corporate author: Boston Christian Science Society 1/1, January 1889-2/12, December 1890. 12 pp. This is an absolutely undistinguished Christian Science journal of the early period, with brief doctrinal exegesis of issues and avoidance of controversy. Troup was an early officer of the Christian Science Association in Boston which Mrs. Eddy dissolved in the reorganization of the Church. Yale University; Harvard University; University of North Carolina, Durham Issues:Boston Christian Scientist V1 1889 Boston Christian Scientist V2 1890
